alert.note: Alert for Bosque (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 7:07AM CDT until October 27 at 3:45AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... North Bosque River Near Clifton affecting Bosque County. Cowhouse Creek Near Pidcoke affecting Coryell County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Bosque River near Clifton. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Moderate out of bank flooding is expected along the river. Water is several feet deep across riverside road in clifton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 21.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 27.6 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
